vicedtools.acer.ewritesittings module¶

Classes for storing eWrite sitting data.

class vicedtools.acer.ewritesittings.EWriteSitting¶

Bases: dict

A class for storing a eWrite sitting result.

group_report(tests)¶

Returns the data provided in a eWrite group report export for this sitting.

class vicedtools.acer.ewritesittings.EWriteSittings(sittings)¶

Bases: list

A class for storing eWrite sitting results.

group_report(tests)¶

Extracts data for the preparation of a group report spreadsheet.

Parameters

  • tests – A OARSTests instance containing the relevant test metadata.

  • test_name – The name of the test to export. E.g. “eWrite”

  • form_name – The name of the form to export. E.g. “Task C Report (Years 5-8)”

Returns

A list of dictionaries containing the relevant columns for each sitting.

vicedtools.acer.oars module¶

Utilities for importing and exporting data into OARS.

vicedtools.acer.oars.class_selector(class_string)¶

Identifies whether a given class name is an english or maths class.

Parameters

class_string – a class code string

Returns

A pandas Series containing two items, “Maths”/”English” and the class code.

vicedtools.acer.oars.student_imports(student_details_file, student_enrolment_file, current_students_file, new_students_file, update_students_file)¶

Creates files to update the OARS student database.

Creates two separate files, one to update the details of existing students in the database and one to add new students.

Parameters

  • student_details_file – a student details export csv from Compass. Can be downloaded using vicedtools.compass.export_student_details or directly from https://[schoolID].compass.education/Services/FileDownload/CsvRequestHandler?type=37

  • student_enrolment_file – a student enrolment file exported from Compass. Can be downloaded using vicedtools.compass.export_student_enrolments

  • current_students_file – a current students export from OARS

  • new_students_file – the filename to save the new students import for OARS

  • update_students_file – the filename to save the update students import for OARS

get_all_items(tests)¶
get_all_pat_sittings(from_date, to_date)¶

Downloads the results for all PAT sittings between the given dates.

Includes both PAT Maths 4th Edition and PAT Reading 5th Edition.

Parameters

  • from_date – The start date to download results for in dd-mm-yyyy format.

  • to_date – The end date to download results for in dd-mm-yyyy format.

Returns

A list of test sittings.

get_candidates(enrolled=1)¶

Gets candidate data.

Parameters

enrolled – 0 for unenrolled students, 1 for enrolled students and 2 for pre-enrolled students.

Returns

An instance of OARSCandidates.

get_ewrite_sittings(candidates, from_date, to_date)¶

Downloads the results for eWrite sittings for the candidates.

Downloads results between to_date and from_date.

Parameters

  • candidates – A OARSCandidates instance with the candidates to get results for.

  • from_date – The start date to download results for in dd-mm-yyyy format.

  • to_date – The end date to download results for in dd-mm-yyyy format.

Returns

A list of test sittings.

get_items(test_id, form_id, sitting_id)¶

Gets PAT Item metadata.

Parameters

  • test_id – The id of the test to get item metadata for.

  • form_id – The id of the form to get item metadata for.

  • sitting_id – The sitting id for a sitting of this test form.

Returns:

get_pat_results(test_name, form_name, from_date, to_date)¶

Downloads the results for a single PAT test.

Parameters

  • test_name – The name of the test. E.g. “PAT Maths 4th Edition”

  • form_name – The form to download. E.g. “PAT Maths Test 6”

  • from_date – The start date to download results for in dd-mm-yyyy format.

  • to_date – The end date to download results for in dd-mm-yyyy format.

Returns

A list of test sittings.

vicedtools.acer.patresults module¶

Classes for storing data from PAT group reports exported from OARS.

The class PATResults stores collated results for a particular PAT test/ test number.

The class PATResultsCollection stores PATResults and organises them by their test/test number. Includes the ability to take a folder containing all of your group report exports and to parse them all in one go.

class vicedtools.acer.patresults.PATResults(test, number, question_scales, results)¶

Bases: object

A class for storing PAT group report data.

test¶

‘Reading’ or ‘Maths’

number¶

The test number as a string. E.g. ‘7’

question_scales¶

A dict containing the scale difficulties for each question in this particular test.

results¶

A pandas DataFrame containing the test results.

Initialises PATResults with the given arguments.

Mostly intended for use by the provided factory methods.

add_group_report(filename)¶

Adds the data from a group report file to this instance.

The test (Reading/Maths) and test number must match those of the group report.

Parameters

filename – The path to the group report xlsx.

Raises

ValueError – Group report test and number do not match.

classmethod from_group_report(filename)¶

Creates a PATResults instance from a single group report.

Parameters

filename – The path to the group report xlsx.

Returns

A PATResults instance.

scores()¶

Returns just the score data from the stored results.

Returns

A pandas Dataframe containing the scores and student identification columns.

class vicedtools.acer.patresults.PATResultsCollection¶

Bases: object

A container for PATResults for different tests and test numbers.

tests¶

A dict with two keys, “Maths” and “Reading” Each key refers to another dict that contains PATResults instances indexed by their test number as a string.

Inits an empty PATResultsCollection.

add_results(patresults)¶

Adds a PATResults to the collection.

Parameters

patresults – The PATResults instance to incorporate into the collection.

export_scores(recent=False)¶

Exports all PAT scores as a single DataFrame.

Parameters

recent – if true, only export each student’s most recent result

Returns

A pandas DataFrame containing just the score information from all tests.

get_results(test, number)¶

Returns the PATResults for a particular test and number.

Parameters

  • test – “Maths” or “Reading”

  • number – The test number as a string.

Returns

The corresponding instance of PATResults contained in the collection, if one exists.

scores()¶
vicedtools.acer.patresults.extract_question_scales(df)¶

Extract question difficulties from the group report.

Searches through the group report cells and finds the columns containing question difficulty scale scores.

Parameters

df – A pandas DataFrame containing the data from a PAT group report xlsx.

Returns

A dictionary containing each question number (str) as a key and the corresponding scale score (float) as values.

Raises

ValueError – DataFrame did not contain expected question scales.

vicedtools.acer.patresults.group_report_metadata(df)¶

Extract the test and test number from the group report DataFrame.

Looks at the top left cell and extracts the relevant test (Reading/ Maths) and test number data.

Parameters

df – A pandas DataFrame containing the data from a PAT group report xlsx.

Returns

A tuple of (test, number), each as strings.

vicedtools.acer.patresults.group_reports_to_patresults(path, verbose=True)¶

Reads all PAT group reports in path.

Parameters

  • path – The directory to search for group report files.

  • verbose – If True, then print the path to each file as it is parsed.

Returns

A PATResultsCollection containg the results from all group reports in the directory.

vicedtools.acer.patresults.is_group_report_file(file_location)¶

Tests whether a given xlsx file contains a PAT Group Report.

Only looks for PAT Reading 5th edition and PAT Maths 4th edition.

Parameters

file_location – The path to the group report xlsx.

Returns

Whether the given xlsx is a PAT group report export.

vicedtools.acer.patresults.locate_header_row(df)¶

Identifies the row in a group report containing the column headings.

Parameters

df – A pandas DataFrame containing the data from a PAT group report xlsx.

Returns

The row number containing the column headings.

Raises

ValueError – DataFrame did not contain the expected header row.

vicedtools.acer.patresults.score_categoriser(test, year_level, datetime_completed, score)¶

Returns a qualitative description of a PAT testing result.

Parameters

  • test – “Maths” or “Reading”

  • year_level – “Year 5”, “Year 6”, “Year 7”, …, “Year 10” the year level of the student when they sat the test

  • date – The date the test was completed.

  • score – the PAT scale score the student achieved

Returns

One of “Very low”, “Low”, “Average”, “High”, or “Very high”.

vicedtools.acer.plots module¶

Functions for creating visualisations of PAT results.

vicedtools.acer.plots.item_analysis_plot(pat_results, question, from_date=None, to_date=None)¶

Creates an item analysis plot for a single PAT question.

Compares the expected performance of students on an item, based on their PAT scale score and the question’s scale score, with their responses. The correct response is expected to be selected more often by students with higher scale scores.

Parameters

  • pat_results – An instance of PATResults to analyse.

  • question – The question number to produce a plot for.

Returns

the matplotlib figure and axes for the plot

Return type

f, ax

vicedtools.acer.plots.item_analysis_plots(results, save_path='', verbose=True, from_date=None, to_date=None)¶

Creates item analysis charts for all tests and questions results.

Creates a chart for each question in each PAT test found in the provided PATResultsCollection and saves each chart as a .png. Files are saved using the format “[save_path][Reading/Maths] test [test number] question [question number].png”

Example usage:

results = group_reports_to_patresults(path_to_group_reports) item_analysis_charts(results)

Parameters

  • results – a PATResultsCollection instance to produce plots from

  • save_path="" – Optional; the path to save plot images to

  • verbose=True – Optional; if True, print information about each chart as it is generated.

vicedtools.acer.plots.question_summary(pat_results, question, open_ended=False, from_date=None, to_date=None)¶

Creates an item analysis summary for a PAT item.

Groups the students by their scale score and then for each group determines the proportion of students that selected each response option. Groups the students in three to five bins depending on how many students there are. Centers the bins based on the distribution of student scale scores and labels the bins based on their relative level compared to the question.

Students with higher scale scores should be observed to select the correct response more often.

Used by item_analysis_plot to summarise item results.

Parameters

  • pat_results – An instance of PATResults to summarise.

  • question – Which question number to produce a summary of.

  • open_ended – Optional; If true, then include outliers in the outermost bins. Otherwise, these students are exluded from the plot.

Returns

A pandas DataFrame with these columns.
’Student v Question’: A qualitative description of the relative

scale score of the students compared to the item.

’Response’: ‘A’, ‘B’, ‘C’, ‘D’, ‘E’, or ‘✓’. ‘Percentage of responses’: as float
